briefdescription.para: No support for the feature.
Optional support for the feature.
Mandatory support for the feature.
This object carry various statistic informations regarding the quality of an audio or video stream for a given LinphoneCall.

detaileddescription.para: To receive these informations periodically and as soon as they are computed, implement the call_stats_updated() callback inside a LinphoneCoreCbs.
At any time, the application can access latest computed statistics using linphone_call_get_audio_stats() and linphone_call_get_video_stats().

briefdescription.para: Get the type of the stream the stats refer to.

simplesect.para: The LinphoneStreamType the stats refer to

briefdescription.para: Get the local loss rate since last report.

simplesect.para: The sender loss rate

briefdescription.para: Gets the remote reported loss rate since last report.

simplesect.para: The receiver loss rate

briefdescription.para: Get the local loss rate since last report.

simplesect.para: The local loss rate

briefdescription.para: Gets the local late rate since last report.

simplesect.para: The local late rate

briefdescription.para: Gets the remote reported interarrival jitter.

simplesect.para: The interarrival jitter at last received receiver report

briefdescription.para: Gets the cumulative number of late packets.

simplesect.para: The cumulative number of late packets

briefdescription.para: Get the bandwidth measurement of the received stream, expressed in kbit/s, including IP/UDP/RTP headers.

simplesect.para: The jitter buffer size in ms.

briefdescription.para: Get the round trip delay in s.

simplesect.para: The round trip delay in s.

briefdescription.para: Get the estimated bandwidth measurement of the received stream, expressed in kbit/s, including IP/UDP/RTP headers.

simplesect.para: The estimated bandwidth measurement of the received stream in kbit/s.

briefdescription.para: Create a new chat room for real time messaging from a call if not already existing, else return existing one.

detaileddescription.para:
No reference is given to the caller: the chat room will be deleted when the call is ended.
call
LinphoneCall object
LinphoneChatRoom where real time messaging can take place or NULL if chat room couldn't be created.

briefdescription.para: Get the mesured playback volume level (received from remote) in dbm0.

simplesect.para: float Volume level in percentage.

briefdescription.para: Get the mesured record volume level (sent to remote) in dbm0.

simplesect.para: float Volume level in percentage.

briefdescription.para: Get speaker volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the returned gain is equal to the gain set with the system mixer.
call
The call.
Percentage of the max supported volume gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ]. In case of failure, a negative value is returned

briefdescription.para: Set speaker volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the new gain will synchronized with the system mixer.
call
The call.
volume
Percentage of the max supported gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ].

briefdescription.para: Get microphone volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the returned gain is equal to the gain set with the system mixer.
call
The LinphoneCall object.
double Percentage of the max supported volume gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ]. In case of failure, a negative value is returned

briefdescription.para: Set microphone volume gain.

detaileddescription.para:
If the sound backend supports it, the new gain will synchronized with the system mixer.
call
The LinphoneCall object.
volume
Percentage of the max supported gain. Valid values are in [ 0.0 : 1.0 ].

briefdescription.para: Get speaker muted state.

simplesect.para: The speaker muted state.

briefdescription.para: Set speaker muted state.
Get microphone muted state.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that the microphone may be disabled globally if FALSE was given to linphone_core_enable_mic().
call
The LinphoneCall object.
The microphone muted state.
This method returns state of the mute capability of the call passed as argument. If this call is part of a conference, it is strongly recommended to call linphone_conference_get_microphone_muted() to know whether this device is muted or not.

briefdescription.para: Set microphone muted state.

detaileddescription.para:
The boolean value given is applied logical-and with the value given to linphone_core_enable_mic().
call
The LinphoneCall object.
muted
The microphone muted state.
This method only mutes the call passed as argument. If this call is part of a conference, it is strongly recommended to call linphone_conference_set_microphone_muted() to ensure that the setting is correctly apply across all participants and the conference callbacks are called.

briefdescription.para: Obtain real-time quality rating of the call.

detaileddescription.para: Based on local RTP statistics and RTCP feedback, a quality rating is computed and updated during all the duration of the call. This function returns its value at the time of the function call. It is expected that the rating is updated at least every 5 seconds or so. The rating is a floating point number comprised between 0 and 5.
4-5 = good quality 3-4 = average quality 2-3 = poor quality 1-2 = very poor quality 0-1 = can't be worse, mostly unusable

simplesect.para: The function returns -1 if no quality measurement is available, for example if no active audio stream exist. Otherwise it returns the quality rating.

briefdescription.para: Returns call quality averaged over all the duration of the call.

detaileddescription.para:
See linphone_call_get_current_quality() for more details about quality measurement.
call
The LinphoneCall object.
the call average quality since tbe beginning of the call.

briefdescription.para: Starts call recording.

detaileddescription.para:
Video record is only available if this function is called in state StreamRunning. The output file where audio is recorded must be previously specified with linphone_call_params_set_record_file().
call
The LinphoneCall object.

briefdescription.para: Stops call recording.
Gets a player associated with the call to play a local file and stream it to the remote peer.

simplesect.para: A LinphonePlayer object

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether an operation is in progress at the media side.

detaileddescription.para:
It can be a bad idea to initiate signaling operations (adding video, pausing the call, removing video, changing video parameters) while the media is busy in establishing the connection (typically ICE connectivity checks). It can result in failures generating loss of time in future operations in the call. Applications are invited to check this function after each call state change to decide whether certain operations are permitted or not.
call
the LinphoneCall
TRUE if media is busy in establishing the connection, FALSE otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Calls generic OpenGL render for a given call.
Sends an info message through an established call.
Returns a copy of the call statistics for a particular stream type.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneCallStats object for the given stream or NULL if stream isn't available.

briefdescription.para: Returns a copy of the call statistics for the audio stream.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneCallStats object for the audio stream or NULL if it isn't available.

briefdescription.para: Returns a copy of the call statistics for the video stream.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneCallStats object for the video stream or NULL if it isn't available.

briefdescription.para: Returns a copy of the call statistics for the text stream.

simplesect.para: a LinphoneCallStats object for the text stream or NULL if it isn't available.

briefdescription.para: Add a listener in order to be notified of LinphoneCall events.

detaileddescription.para:
Once an event is received, registred LinphoneCallCbs are invoked sequencially.
call
LinphoneCall object. to monitor.
cbs
A LinphoneCallCbs object holding the callbacks you need. A reference is taken by the LinphoneCall until you invoke linphone_call_remove_callbacks().

briefdescription.para: Remove a listener from a LinphoneCall.
Gets the current LinphoneCallCbs.

detaileddescription.para:
This is meant only to be called from a callback to be able to get the user_data associated with the LinphoneCallCbs that is calling the callback.
call
LinphoneCall object.
The LinphoneCallCbs that has called the last callback

briefdescription.para: Set call parameters - advanced and not recommended feature - use with caution.

detaileddescription.para: Local call parameters applicable to an outgoing or incoming shall usually be passed to linphone_core_invite_address_with_params() or linphone_call_accept_with_params(). However, in some cases it might be desirable from a software design standpoint to modify local parameters outside of the application layer, typically in the purpose of implementing a custom logic including special headers in INVITE or 200Ok requests, driven by a call_state_changed listener method. This function accepts to assign a new LinphoneCallParams only in LinphoneCallOutgoingInit and LinphoneCallIncomingReceived states.

briefdescription.para: Returns local parameters associated with the call.

detaileddescription.para:
This is typically the parameters passed at call initiation to linphone_core_invite_address_with_params() or linphone_call_accept_with_params(), or some default parameters if no LinphoneCallParams was explicitely passed during call initiation.
call
the LinphoneCall object
the call's local parameters.

briefdescription.para: Sets the given LinphoneAudioDevice as input for this call only.
Sets the given LinphoneAudioDevice as output for this call only.
Gets the current input device for this call.

simplesect.para: the LinphoneAudioDevice used by this call as input or NULL if there is currently no soundcard configured (depending on the state of the call)

briefdescription.para: Gets the current output device for this call.

simplesect.para: the LinphoneAudioDevice used by this call as output or NULL if there is currently no soundcard configured (depending on the state of the call)

briefdescription.para: Starts the process of replying 180 Ringing.

detaileddescription.para: This function is used in conjonction with linphone_core_enable_auto_send_ringing(). If the automatic sending of the 180 Ringing is disabled, this function needs to be called manually before the call timeouts.

briefdescription.para: Sets the video source of a call.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneVideoSourceDescriptor describing the video source to set

briefdescription.para: Gets the video source of a call.

simplesect.para: The LinphoneVideoSourceDescriptor describing the video source that is set

briefdescription.para: Method to be called after the user confirm that he/she is notifed of the on going Go Clear procedure.

simplesect.para: this operation must be imperatevely initiate by a user action on sending of the GoClear ACK

briefdescription.para: Redirect the specified call to the given redirect URI.

parameterdescription.para: The URI to redirect the call to

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, -1 on error.

briefdescription.para: Performs a simple call transfer to the specified destination.

detaileddescription.para:
The remote endpoint is expected to issue a new call to the specified destination. The current call remains active and thus can be later paused or terminated. It is possible to follow the progress of the transfer provided that transferee sends notification about it. In this case, the transfer_state_changed callback of the LinphoneCoreVTable is invoked to notify of the state of the new call at the other party. The notified states are LinphoneCallOutgoingInit , LinphoneCallOutgoingProgress, LinphoneCallOutgoingRinging and LinphoneCallConnected.
call
The call to be transfered
refer_to
The destination the call is to be refered to.
0 on success, -1 on failure
Deprecated
27/10/2020. Use linphone_call_transfer_to() instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns the remote address associated to this call as a string.

detaileddescription.para:
The result string must be freed by user using ms_free().
call
LinphoneCall object.
the remote address as a string.
Deprecated
06/07/2020 use linphone_call_get_remote_address() instead.

briefdescription.para: Perform a zoom of the video displayed during a call.

parameterdescription.para: a floating point number describing the zoom factor. A value 1.0 corresponds to no zoom applied.
a floating point number pointing the horizontal center of the zoom to be applied. This value should be between 0.0 and 1.0.
a floating point number pointing the vertical center of the zoom to be applied. This value should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

xrefdescription.para: 16/10/2017 use linphone_call_zoom instead cx and cy are updated in return in case their coordinates were too excentrated for the requested zoom factor. The zoom ensures that all the screen is fullfilled with the video.

briefdescription.para: Return TRUE if this call is currently part of a conference.

simplesect.para: TRUE if part of a conference.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether or not the call is currently being recorded.

parameterdescription.para: LinphoneCall for which we can to know the recording state

simplesect.para: TRUE if recording is in progress, FALSE otherwise

memberdef.name: LINPHONE_VOLUME_DB_LOWEST
memberdef.initializer: (-120) /* WARNING: keep this in sync with mediastreamer2/msvolume.h */

briefdescription.para: Lowest volume measurement that can be returned by linphone_call_get_play_volume() or linphone_call_get_record_volume(), corresponding to pure silence.
received_rtcp field of LinphoneCallStats object has been updated
sent_rtcp field of LinphoneCallStats object has been updated
Every seconds LinphoneCallStats object has been updated.
Obtaining information about a running call: sound volumes, quality indicators.

detaileddescription.para: When a call is running, it is possible to retrieve in real time current measured volumes and quality indicator.
